info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 7:23PM MST until July 31 at 9:15PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 915 PM MST. * At 723 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon Ranch, Stockton Hill Road, and Antares Road. This includes the following roads... Pierce Ferry Road between mile markers 27 and 28. Antares Road between mile markers 16 and 29. Diamond Bar Road between mile markers 1 and 13. This includes the following streams and drainages... Lost Creek, Reference Point Creek, Colorado River, Iron Spring Wash, Fox Canyon Wash, Spencer Canyon, Grapevine Wash, Truxton Wash and Hualapai Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
